snippet: In his first public appearance since the announcement of his resignation, Pope Benedict XVI said he no longer had the strength needed to carry out the duties of the papacy.
abstract: Pope Benedict XVI presides over Ash Wednesday services, his final public Mass, at St Peter's Basilica, thanking faithful for their support during his nearly eight-year pontificate, which will end on Feb 28 when he becomes first pope to resign in almost 600 years.

byline.original: By ELISABETTA POVOLEDO and ALAN COWELL
byline.contributor: Elisabetta Povoledo reported from Vatican City, and Alan Cowell from Paris. Gaia Pianigiani contributed reporting from Rome.

lead_paragraph: In his first public appearance since the announcement of his resignation, Pope Benedict XVI said he no longer had the strength needed to carry out the duties of the papacy.

headline.seo: Pope Makes First Public Appearance Since Decision to Resign
headline.main: Pope Ushers In Lent, Making Its Message of Sacrifice Personal This Year
headline.print_headline: Pope Ushers In Lent, Making Its Message of Sacrifice Personal This Year
